remarks: Given the equivalences set in the hypotheses, there exist a proof where ch, th, ta, et match ph, ps accordingly (Contributed by Jarvin Udandy, 6-Sep-2016.)
statement:
mdandyv4.1 $e |- ( ph <-> F. ) $.
mdandyv4.2 $e |- ( ps <-> T. ) $.
mdandyv4.3 $e |- ( ch <-> F. ) $.
mdandyv4.4 $e |- ( th <-> F. ) $.
mdandyv4.5 $e |- ( ta <-> T. ) $.
mdandyv4.6 $e |- ( et <-> F. ) $.
mdandyv4 $p |- ( ( ( ( ch <-> ph ) /\ ( th <-> ph ) ) /\ ( ta <-> ps ) ) /\ ( et <-> ph ) ) $.
